oai_dc:dc.dc:title: South Korean Tiger Division soldiers riding an armored personnel carrier
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: While TSLA houses an item, it does not necessarily hold the copyright on the item, nor may it be able to determine if the item is still protected under current copyright law. Users are solely responsible for determining the existence of such instances and for obtaining any other permissions and paying associated fees that may be necessary for the intended use.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Two South Korean soldiers of the Tiger Division appear riding on an armored personnel carrier that has the image of a tiger painted on the front. To the left are the mountains and to the right and behind the tank are at least one soldier, some trucks and equipment, and the edge of the signal arrays.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Armored vehicles; Tanks (Military science); Military personnel; Soldiers; Military uniforms; Military facilities; Signal stations
Republic of Korea; Armored personnel carriers; United States. Army. Military Police Company, 194th; Vietnam War, 1961-1975; Vietnam; Qui Nhon (Vietnam); Ammons, Christopher D., 1948-
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Ammons, Christopher D., 1948-
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The South Korean Tiger Division was officially the Republic of Korea (ROK) Capital Division. This unit arrived in Qui Nhon during October 1965. Its deployment for the duration of South Korean involvement in the conflict was between Qui Nhon and Binh Khe in Binh Dinh Province of Vietnam.
